title: Shania Twain
summary: Eilleen "Shania" Twain[1] OC (/aɪˈliːn/ eye-LEEN, /ʃənaɪə/; born Eilleen Regina Edwards; August 28, 1965) is a Canadian singer and songwriter. She has sold over 100 million records, making her the best-selling female artist in country music history and one of the best-selling music artists of all time.[2][3][4] Her success garnered her several honorific titles including the "Queen of Country Pop".[5][6] Billboard named her as the leader of the '90s country-pop crossover stars.[7]
